title: BDIP15 (Formal vote): Defer rewards on BSD/Stable pools until BSD > $1
body:
Chungus on Telegram contributed significantly to this proposal design.

Background:
At present, BSD/stable pools continue to emit BSDS, even while BSD < $1.  This emission creates downwards pressure on BSD, while not helping incentivize movement of BSD to $1.

Proposal:
Align interest of BSD/stable farmers with the overall ecosystem's objective of pegging BSD at $1.  To do this, we propose:
(1) Pause all emissions of BSDS rewards to BSD/stable pools while BSD < $1.
(2) These paused emissions continue to accrue, that is, they will be paid out at a future date when BSD > $1. 

For example, we can take block-by-block snapshots of addresses owning LP tokens in the BSD/stable pools.  This will allow distribution of accrued BSDS at a later date (similar to the model adopted by Balancer).

Advantages:
1. Reduce downward pressure on BSDS.
2. No loss of BSDS by BSD/stable farmers.  They are just accruing for later distribution.
3. Aligns BSD/stable farmers with the ecosystem: Everyone gets rewarded when BSD > $1.
4. Potentially, some BSD/stable farmers may cease LPing due to deferred rewards emissions, which means that there may be less resistance (or costs) in moving BSD towards $1.

Disadvantages:
1. BSD/stable farmers' rewards are temporarily locked up.  However, this is no different than the vesting in Sushiswap, Luaswap, and other projects.
